body: Armed only with a stick, Eilene Rockette stood outside wearing rain boots, a sweatshirt and sweat pants while being drenched by what felt like buckets of water. She yelled to others peering out from their apartments to help her clear debris that had clogged several drains on the street. The date was Aug. 29, 2005, the place was Lafayette, La., and
title: THE NEEDIEST CASES; Used to Taking Charge, but Finding Herself in Need

body: MORE than a neighborhood, Flatbush often refers to a sprawling community in central Brooklyn comprising multiple smaller ones. ''It really seems like a catchall for anything,'' said Lenny Linsker, a real estate investor. ''If an area is not definitely a different part of Brooklyn, it's Flatbush.'' But many smaller neighborhoods traditionally under
title: LIVING IN | FLATBUSH, BROOKLYN; Note to City Dwellers: Steals Available Here

author: Meryl Gordon, a contributing editor for New York magazine, is writing a book on Brooke Astor's final years.

title: Metro Briefing

author: Gabriel Thompson is the author of ''There's No José Here: Following the Hidden Lives of Mexican Immigrants.'' His most recent book is ''Calling All Radicals.''
body: HUDOYKUL HAFIZOV, a soft-spoken, slightly built immigrant from Uzbekistan, works as inventory manager at Silver Rod Pharmacy in Bensonhurst, Brooklyn, and he has a favorite joke: ''A person who knows three languages is trilingual. ''Someone who knows two languages is bilingual. ''But do you know what they call a person who speaks only one
title: The United Nations of Brooklyn

body: Q. How expensive is it to have a button-tufted sofa re-covered? A.Button-tufted upholstery has been returning to the design world radar in recent years, particularly among decorators enamored with the plush furniture silhouettes of the 1860s. This luxurious type of upholstery was especially popular during the reign of the last French emperor,
title: ROOM TO IMPROVE | How expensive is it to have a button-tufted sofa re-covered?

body: THE national median home price right now is $224,500. But finding anything even close to that in New York -- where the average sale price for a Manhattan apartment hovers just above $1.3 million -- would be like snagging a seat on a downtown No. 6 train at the height of rush hour. Or would it? In the current market, staying in Manhattan for
title: Even in New York, Affordable Apartments

body: Fiske Terrace and Midwood Park look and feel much as they did a century ago, when the conjoined neighborhoods were built on razed farmland in central Brooklyn. Their grand wood frame houses in the Queen Anne and Colonial Revival styles, with broad front porches, peaked roofs and lush gardens, evoke gracious country living within the city. It is not
title: FISKE TERRACE/MIDWOOD PARK; Aging Beauties, Factory-Made

author: E-mail: streetscapes@nytimes.com
body: THERE is a reason that the two huge red brick mansions sitting side by side in Ditmas Park, Brooklyn, seem near twins: they were designed by the same architect and built for branches of the same family in 1899. But both have suffered rough treatment since then. Today, the Brush house, at 1010 Ocean Avenue, seems poised for a happy rejuvenation,
title: STREETSCAPES | OCEAN AVENUE, BROOKLYN; Kissing Cousins at 100: Only One Shows Its Age

body: There was a two-digit footnote to tragedy tucked behind the name of a fallen firefighter, Robert Beddia, who died Aug. 18 in the blaze at the Deutsche Bank skyscraper at ground zero. It was his age. Firefighter Beddia was 53, the senior man at his SoHo firehouse and the senior firefighter at the seven-alarm fire that day. He was one of only 502
title: Past 50, and Still Running Into the Flames

body: WHEN Janey Lee and Pablo Agüero were struggling freelance Web designers, buying an apartment in Manhattan seemed like a dream, one clouded by credit-card debt, student loans that had to be repaid and the bills for their wedding. But now, five years later, they are about to move into a $445,000 two-bedroom condo in Hamilton Heights, in Upper
title: Every Penny Counts

title: Truck and Bag of Cologne Lead to Alarms

body: WHEN Kazi Hossain, a real estate broker in Ditmas Park, Brooklyn, telephoned a client recently to describe a house for sale, he played up one of the property's most desirable attributes. title: While Brooklyn Sips

body: Voters in central Brooklyn do not lack for choices in the February 20th special election to fill the City Council seat vacated by Yvette Clarke. title: Jesse Hamilton for City Council
